title: Helen Willetts
text:
Helen Willetts is a <a href="meteorologist">meteorologist</a> on the <a href="BBC">BBC</a>. She appears regularly on <a href="BBC%20News%20%28TV%20channel%29">BBC News</a>, <a href="BBC%20World%20News">BBC World News</a>, <a href="BBC%20Red%20Button">BBC Red Button</a>, <a href="BBC%20Radio%204">BBC Radio 4</a>, <a href="BBC%20Radio%205%20Live">BBC Radio 5 Live</a> and <a href="BBC%20Radio%202">BBC Radio 2</a>. Willetts is an occasional weather forecaster on the <a href="BBC%20News%20at%20Ten">BBC News at Ten</a> on <a href="BBC%20One">BBC One</a>.
Early life.
Willetts was born in <a href="Chester">Chester</a>, England. She was educated at <a href="Ysgol%20Eirias">Ysgol Eirias</a> (Eirias High School) in <a href="Colwyn%20Bay">Colwyn Bay</a>, Wales. She obtained a first class honours degree in <a href="Physics">Physics</a> at the <a href="University%20of%20Nottingham">University of Nottingham</a> in 1993.
In February 1994, Willetts joined the <a href="Met%20Office">Met Office</a> to begin a five-month weather forecaster training course at the Met Office College based at the former <a href="RAF%20Shinfield%20Park">RAF Shinfield Park</a>.
Broadcasting career.
In July 1994, Willetts moved to the Weather Centre in <a href="Cardiff">Cardiff</a>. From 1995, she was a forecaster on both <a href="BBC%20Television">BBC Television</a> and <a href="BBC%20Radio">BBC Radio</a> in <a href="Wales">Wales</a>.
In 1997, she joined <a href="BBC%20Weather">BBC Weather</a> in <a href="London">London</a> to work for <a href="BBC%20News">BBC News</a>.
Awards.
In March 2006, she was awarded the <a href="Television%20and%20Radio%20Industries%20Club">Television and Radio Industry Club (TRIC) award</a> for best TV weather presenter.
Personal life.
Helen played <a href="badminton">badminton</a> internationally for <a href="Wales">Wales</a>. She enjoys walking, cycling and travelling.
